cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 420 mi SSW of Apalachee Bay / Apalachicola, Florida

motion.direction: W (expected to turn N then NNE later today)

cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to drift north today, then accelerate north-northeast, crossing the northwest Florida coast Thursday and moving offshore the southeast U.S. coast Friday–Saturday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northwest Florida coast between Anclote River and Indian Pass

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch Anclote River to Indian Pass, Tropical Storm Watch west of Indian Pass to Walton/Bay County line (Gulf coast of FL)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Gulf coast of Florida from Aripeka to Indian Pass, then across the Florida peninsula and up the coasts of Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Likely (5–10 inches possible across much of the Florida peninsula)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds unlikely; only brief gusts possible (≤39 mph)
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Atlantic side near PortMiami
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain Thursday–Friday with potential totals 5–10 inches; localized flooding possible
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes or waterspouts possible in outer rain-bands; brief interruptions to port operations from heavy rain and squalls
